Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: @barv awesome slides - I'm a bit sceptic about the slides, but I am super biased of course as a game developer myself

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: just some points for the "future" when you are going to interact with game developers;

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content:
- don't use games as example that are from Rockstar; they are very hostile towards blockchain gaming and have been a driving force to hold back the industry in blockchain technology adoption. Ubisoft on the other hand, is something different :)
- usage of the Playstation console image is probably going to contradict, because technically speaking, Komodo would breach about five terms of service (there is a NDA regarding Playstation development so I can't be very specific), but if you read the public EULA, a real "ownership" of assets on the  console is not going to happen plus there is PSN that is required for distribution of games that would further limit the tech,

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: @barv Integration is probably covered with the RogueCC demo, but I'd probably would suggest a SWOT in blochchain development; the missing links for example.

Author: TwilightPunkster K64#7533
Content: just my two cents

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: Yes the CC (tx signing) via mobile (SPV/lite mode) will make the next iteration of blockchain gaming go stratospheric.   we are currently looking at the "CEX for games" atm.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: via rest api.  or you run your blockchain with your game (or embed it into the game).

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: only my opinion.    but CEX works still for a lot of ppl that want instant gratification of trading....same for games no doubt.  as long as assets/value can be transferred out of the hosted gaming env to your own wallet - it works.  like "save game" you own.
